channel.title: Decompiling RSC private server clients
channel.description:
So I tried decompiling some RSC private server clients. They had no obfuscation. I used DJ Java decompiler(which is based on JAD), also tried JAD by itself alone. They managed to decompile it, but with errors.
[code]Parsing mudclient.class...Parsing inner class mudclient$1.class... Generating mudclient.java Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method handleIncomingPacket Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method getServerStatus[/code]
For example this. I even tried with a client that I had source for to eliminate the obfuscation possibility. Same thing.
Any suggestions on decompilers? JODE totally fucked up itself.
[url=http://www.speedyshare.com/579156633.html]http://www.speedyshare.com/579156633.html[/url] The client I'm trying to decompile. Could someone try? I've included the files for making a new build of it.

item.title: Decompiling RSC private server clients
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Provided the client will recompile, they arn’t errors and it has been successfully decompiled.
I haven’t personally tried.
In my opinion the best way to write a bot for an RSC private server is to download the standard 202 client (or whichever the server uses) and modify whatever needs modifying for the server to accept it.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompiling RSC private server clients
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

they arent really errors

Read full topic
